title: IDAPython loading parameters bruteforce
content:
I have a binary file for known hardware platform, but nothing more is known. 
When I load this file in IDA (with default parameters), nothing good happens - at least does not appear xrefs to readable strings.
I suggest that the case in the loading parameters: the loading address and the entry point. Maybe some even.
The only solution I see in the bruteforce these parameters and re-launch auto analysis. Before that I would like to help IDA by designation some pieces of code - readable strings as strings, small common hardware patterns as code pieces.
Success criteria - the appearance of xrefs to the strings.
Unfortunately I'm newbie in IDAPython, and I'm only has learned to show to IDA strings (by MakeStr-function).
How can I change loading parameters and launch full auto-analysis in IDAPython script?

comments.text: Before you go ahead and bruteforce - what do you know about the platform? Do you know the hardware's boot address and such?
Unfortunately I'm know only platform type - PowerPC and nothing more.
And is the binary file the full firmware?
I'm not sure, but I'm assuming that it is not full firmware, most likely, this is only part of the changeable firmware.
Do you have a running version of the software, or only the binary?
